units.name: Phantom
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

units.name: Lens
units.prompt: Use scan to reveal enemy prompts and cloaked units. Stay at max range (≤4 tiles for scan). Use recalibrate on wounded allies to buff them. Keep distance from enemies and avoid adjacent vectors.

units.name: Aegis
units.prompt: Advance toward the nearest enemy. Use shield_wall facing the direction with the most enemies. If an enemy is adjacent, attack them.

units.name: Deadeye
units.prompt: Position for clear sight lines. Prioritize killing wounded enemies with precision_shot. If forced to move, retreat away from threats. Suppressing_fire to slow rushers.

units.name: Wraith
units.prompt: Stay cloaked and flank. Prioritize assassinating the enemy damage dealer. Use breach on sentinels to break their defensive posture. Recloak whenever it drops.

units.name: Remedy
units.prompt: Stay adjacent to the most threatened ally. Use patch on the most wounded teammate. If all healthy, use overclock on your damage dealer.

actions.thinking: Round 1 — cloak immediately as ordered. Then advance toward Deadeye at (4,4), moving to (4,3) to close distance while cloaked. Next turns I can reach Deadeye or Remedy for shadow_strike.

Both Deadeye and Remedy are at dist=4 but the recon shows them as out of range from current position. I need to move closer to bring them into scan range. Moving to (3,2) adds 1 to y, giving dist=3 to Remedy at (3,5) and dist=3 to Deadeye at (4,4). From (3,2) I can scan Remedy to reveal their prompt.

Round 1, good time to cloak as the TIP suggests. Both enemies are out of range. Lens is the priority target (oracle = damage dealer) at dist 4, behind tile at (3,1). I need to advance toward Lens while cloaking. Move toward Lens first, then cloak to stay hidden as I approach.
actions.firstResult: Specter can move through but not end on occupied tile

actions.thinking: All allies are at full HP, so no healing needed. Orders say to use overclock on damage dealer if all healthy. Deadeye is the striker (damage dealer) at (4,4), distance 2. I need to get adjacent to Deadeye to use overclock. Moving to (4,5) puts me adjacent to Deadeye at (4,4). Then I can use overclock on Deadeye to boost their damage output next turn.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Lens (oracle) is at (3,2), dist=3, which is within my range of 2... wait, dist=3 means it's 3 tiles away and my precision_shot range is ≤2 tiles. I need to move closer. If I move to (3,3), Lens at (3,2) would be dist=1, in range. But if I move first, precision_shot deals 1dmg instead of 2dmg. Better to shoot first, then move. But Lens is at dist=3 from current position — out of precision_shot range (≤2). So I must move first to get in range. Move to (3,3) puts Lens at dist=1. Then use precision_shot for 1dmg (moved penalty). With overclocked I have 2 ability uses — use precision_shot twice on Lens for 1+1=2dmg total. That would kill a healthy Lens (assuming 3-4HP). Actually let me reconsider: move to (4,3) puts me at dist=2 from Lens at (3,2) — still in range, closer. Or (3,3) is dist=1. Either way I moved so it's 1dmg per shot. Two shots = 2dmg. Worth doing.
No enemies in range. Need to advance toward nearest enemy Deadeye at (4,4). Moving to (4,0) gets me closest while staying on valid tiles. Then shield_wall facing N where enemies are concentrated.

Remedy is at dist 4 from current position — just out of scan range. If I move one tile closer toward Remedy (e.g. to (3,3)), Remedy will be at dist 3 and scannable. Deadeye is already at dist 3 and in range. Priority: move to (3,3) to bring Remedy into scan range (dist=3), then scan Deadeye to reveal their prompt and deal 1 damage. Remedy's prompt is already known. Deadeye is the damage threat — scanning them is high value.

Cloak expires after this turn. Remedy medic is high-value target. I can move to (3,5) to get behind Remedy (facing E, so behind is west side at (3,5)), then shadow_strike to deal damage while maintaining cloak. This removes the enemy healer threat.

Cloak expires end of this turn. Phantom is a specter (enemy damage dealer) and I can reach position (3,4) which is directly behind them (they face N, so south is behind). Move to (3,4) then breach Phantom to control them next turn. This eliminates the enemy specter threat and wastes their turn.

secondAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward the edge, do not attack

actions.thinking: Deadeye is wounded at (4,4) with 3/4 HP and is adjacent to me (dist=1). I need to patch Deadeye. However, Phantom is at (3,5) which is adjacent to me — my patch ability is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector, not enemy in general. Phantom is a specter, not a Vector, so patch is not blocked. Wait — the rule says 'patch/overclock blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector' — Vector is a class/unit type. Phantom is a specter class, so no block. I can use patch on Deadeye at (4,4). After patching, I should move away from Phantom if possible, or stay to support Deadeye.

Two enemies in range from current position: Phantom at (3,5) dist=2 and Lens at (3,3) dist=2. I haven't moved this turn, so precision_shot does full 2dmg. Phantom is a specter (high threat/mobility), Lens is an oracle. Both are healthy. I'll fire precision_shot at Phantom to chunk them down, then wait or hold position. No adjacent enemies so precision_shot is not blocked.

All enemies are to the north. Nearest is Deadeye at (4,4), dist 4. I can move up to 2 tiles. Moving to (4,2) gets me closer (dist 2 from Deadeye). Then use shield_wall facing N to protect against incoming fire from the north.

I'm already behind Phantom (facing N, I'm at 3,4 which is south of them). Breach is on cooldown (1 turn remaining), so I can't use it. But I can shadow_strike Phantom since they're adjacent — this keeps cloak if I have it, but I'm not cloaked. I should use shadow_strike on Phantom (adjacent, dist=1) to deal damage without breaking cloak status concerns. Then I can move to (3,2) to get behind Lens for next turn's breach. Actually, let me shadow_strike Phantom first (they're the enemy specter — dangerous flanker), then reposition behind Lens at (3,2) to set up a breach next turn when cooldown expires.
Orders are to move away from allies and toward the edge, no attacking. Allies are at (4,2) and (3,3). Moving to (0,5) takes me to the top-left corner edge, far from allies. Then wait.

All allies are at full HP, so no healing needed. Orders say use overclock on damage dealer if all healthy. Deadeye (striker) is the damage dealer at (4,4), adjacent to me at (5,4) — distance 1, so adjacent. I can use overclock on Deadeye immediately. No need to move first.

Wraith is adjacent at (3,2) — scan is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector, but Wraith is a specter not a vector, so scan should work. However, Wraith is only dist=1 which is within scan range (≤4). I should scan Wraith to reveal their prompt. But wait — I'm at (3,3) and Wraith is at (3,2), dist=1. Scan deals 1 dmg and reveals prompt. That's useful. After scanning, I should move away from Wraith to avoid being adjacent next turn. Moving to (2,4) keeps distance from Wraith and stays in range of enemies. Or I could move first then scan. If I move to (2,4), Wraith is at dist=2+1=... (3,2) to (2,4) = |3-2|+|2-4|=1+2=3, still in scan range. Let me move to (2,4) first to get away from Wraith adjacency, then scan Wraith from safer distance. Actually scan is blocked by adjacent VECTOR not specter — so I can scan Wraith now. Better to scan first (while certain of position), then move away. Scan Wraith at (3,2), then move to (2,5) or (1,3) to increase distance.

I'm overclocked with 2 ability uses. Both Aegis and Lens are in range at dist=2. I haven't moved so precision_shot deals full 2dmg. Phantom is wounded but out of range at dist=5. Priority: use both precision_shots on Lens and Aegis. No need to move - current position has both targets in range.

Wraith is adjacent at (3,2). Orders say attack adjacent enemies. I should attack Wraith first, then consider shield_wall. Deadeye is at (4,4) to my north, Wraith to my west. Most enemies are to my north/northwest. After attacking Wraith, use shield_wall facing N to block Deadeye's direction.

Foresight shows Deadeye will use precision_shot on me at (2,4) this round. I need to move to avoid that shot. All enemies already scanned so no scan needed. Phantom is wounded at (0,5) — I should recalibrate to buff them. Best move: reposition to avoid Deadeye's shot targeting (2,4), then recalibrate Phantom. Moving to (1,5) puts me adjacent to Phantom at (0,5) for recalibrate, and gets me out of Deadeye's current precision_shot target. Distance from (1,5) to Deadeye (4,4) = 4, still within scan range if needed. Move first to (1,5), then recalibrate Phantom.

secondAction.addendum: You are wounded but critical to our flank. Deadeye at (4,4) will precision_shot wounded targets — stay mobile and avoid their line of sight. Wraith is also wounded and will try to assassinate damage dealers. Strike Wraith first to eliminate the flanking threat, then pressure Deadeye.

actions.thinking: I'm at (3,2) with 2HP, adjacent to Aegis at (4,2). Aegis faces N, so I need to get behind at (4,1) for breach. I can move to (4,1) first — that puts me behind Aegis — then breach. Orders say to use breach on sentinels to break defensive posture, and breach is ready. At 2HP I'm fragile, but breach is better than a direct attack. Move to (4,1), then breach Aegis targeting (4,2) with addendum to move away from allies and expose themselves.

secondAction.addendum: Move north away from your team and hold position, exposing yourself to allied fire.

Phantom is wounded and at dist=2 — priority kill. I haven't moved this turn so precision_shot deals 2dmg. Aegis is healthy at dist=2 but sentinel is lower priority. Target Phantom with precision_shot for the kill, then wait since I'm not adjacent to any enemy blocking the shot.

Actually, I should consider: Aegis is a sentinel (defensive), Phantom is the critical enemy specter and priority kill target per orders, but I can't reach Phantom. With 2HP I'm vulnerable. Deadeye is a striker at (4,4) who can likely handle Aegis. My best move might be to reposition toward Phantom for next turn while attacking Aegis now to soften it. Attack Aegis first (1 dmg), then move toward Phantom direction. Or move first to get distance from danger. Given I'm at 2HP, I'll attack Aegis (it's right there, I'm behind it), then move toward Phantom to set up next turn assassination.

All enemies already scanned. Phantom is critical at (5,5) — Deadeye will precision_shot (3,5) next, so Phantom should avoid moving there. I need to recalibrate Phantom to warn them. Phantom is at critical HP at (5,5) distance 2 — priority kill. I can fire precision_shot at Phantom for 2dmg which should finish them (critical). Lens being adjacent doesn't block unless they're a Vector. So: fire precision_shot at Phantom to kill, then move away from Lens to safety.

Orders are to move north away from team and hold position. Valid moves north include (4,1) and (4,2). Moving to (4,2) gets me furthest north while staying on valid tiles. I'll move there and wait — no enemies in range so no ability use.

Move to (4,3) then recalibrate Aegis at (4,2) with addendum to focus on Wraith/Remedy cluster.

From (3,4), Aegis at (4,3) is dist=sqrt(1+1)≈1.41 which is ≤2. But I haven't moved yet so precision_shot does full 2dmg. Let me move to (3,4) then fire precision_shot at Aegis.
